channel.title: Delta
channel.description: Why so much hate on delta? Always when I'm browsing rune-server or moparscape I find some hate messages to the delta base? Can someone explain why please.

item.title: Delta
item.dc:creator: @wartek wartek
item.description:
@wartek wrote:

Well I started coding in delta and I thought it’s amazing.
Now I learned some more java and changed my source to a pi one and it seems to be more proper.
Better conventions , no files of 1mb etc.
So I think I now understand why so much hate on it ^^

Read full topic

item.title: Delta
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:9, topic:452837”][quote author=Native^ link=topic=555706.msg4068357#msg4068357 date=1344114588]

  • Networking is shit
  • Almost no use of OOP, while Java is almost pure OOP
  • Terrible design
  • All the data loading (npc, players) is even more shit than the design

more to come
[/quote]
PI uses the same way of player and npc updating & loading as delta.
what in god’s name is OOP[/quote]

So does Apollo.

Read full topic

item.title: Delta
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“kingman002, post:22, topic:452837”]Back then, People only used Delta because it was a complete server, they just had to do very simple things and host. (Wow, that seems like PI and Matrix nowadays, doesn’t it?)

The remaining people who still use delta are a few noobs, and then there’s the people who rewrote a lot in it like Randqm and enzo.

Once you learn some actual Java and learn what packaging is then take a look at deltascape you realize it’s not that great.

Also to mention people only recommend those complete servers to the noobs. There’s many tutorials for noobs and most of them recommend pi sources[/quote]

There are only two Deltas on the toplist: Pblord’s, and mine. It’s such an obscure source.

Read full topic

item.title: Delta
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

Back then, People only used Delta because it was a complete server, they just had to do very simple things and host. (Wow, that seems like PI and Matrix nowadays, doesn’t it?)

The remaining people who still use delta are a few noobs, and then there’s the people who rewrote a lot in it like Randqm and enzo.

Once you learn some actual Java and learn what packaging is then take a look at deltascape you realize it’s not that great.

Also to mention people only recommend those complete servers to the noobs. There’s many tutorials for noobs and most of them recommend pi sources

Read full topic

item.title: Delta
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

^^^
Who isn’t a better delta lover than RandQm?

I started with Delta and programmed with it (AKA toyed with it (Give me a rest, I was 9)). I loved it, and I still do :D.

Read full topic

item.title: Delta
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:19, topic:452837”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=555706.msg4071131#msg4071131 date=1344363031]

dead code, no conventions in the code(delta said it himself) process that’s packed shit full, 1MB+ client.java, dupes, dupes, dupes, and to sum it all up

  • Networking is shit
  • Almost no use of OOP, while Java is almost pure OOP
  • Terrible design
  • All the data loading (npc, players) is even more shit than the design

more to come

Not in my delta
As far it’s still a delta, there’s nothing left of it
[/quote]I use Utopia, it’s great for a beginner in programming (me), what all did you do to optimize it?[/quote]
I just released a new server, much better than the utopia release,
you can also read there what i did, check server downloads

Read full topic

item.title: Delta
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:16, topic:452837”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=555706.msg4069047#msg4069047 date=1344188678]

dead code, no conventions in the code(delta said it himself) process that’s packed shit full, 1MB+ client.java, dupes, dupes, dupes, and to sum it all up

What about mine?

135 kb client.java, most of process is turned into events / other things, no dead code

Yours still probably sucks no offense, and most of your process is turned into events doesn’t mean anything. It’s still constantly running. While it might be better than most, Delta will never be good enough really. If you rewrite most of the stuff that makes it shitty you wouldn’t even be able to consider it delta anymore.
[/quote]Depends how far you go with rewriting, if I rewrote the networking system, I’d still call it Deltascape based :P[/quote]

Well yeah, but it would still be a fairly bad source still.

Read full topic

item.title: Delta
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“wartek, post:4, topic:452837”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=555706.msg4068224#msg4068224 date=1344104087]
It’s not the most reliable server around, and it was(is still?) over used much like PI.
[/quote]
Can you give arguments? explain why it isn’t a reliable server?[/quote]
From my knowledge it just isn’t efficient. Although PI isn’t exactly the holy grail of servers, it is better.

Read full topic
